text: <http://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/lily-pox-2/>  For anyone interested in offering opinions I'm drafting a Pox deck.

Generally speaking I'd say 27 bodies is too many in a deck not cheating stuff into play or being aristocrats/elfball. IMO people tend to run too many creatures in general, and I say this as someone who primarily wins by turning bodies sideways.
I guess a lot of them are functionally spells in this case
cheat via reanimate
Yeah...this should probably have more of a renaimation subtheme.
agreed
Draw is maybe lean, but I'm of the mind that if I'm not holding 15 cards in hand something has gone terribly wrong
lots of way to hate, not enough ways to gain off the hate
also, no [[small pox]]!?

I run it in gonti
Blood Pet is...1 black...it has that going for it :wink:
it is wonderful
I would say cut blood pet, but I still want to make thrull tribal
and blood pet is thrull, so I can’t not let him be
Blood Pet also auto flips Lili when she comes down with it in play.
Which is helpful since the deck is using her planeswalker side as the deck's engine.
I'd also dump Pestilence Demon...honestly. I'd add in [[Mirage Mirror]]

When in doubt, Mirage Mirror

Yeah, it's a good card in general, but in mono-black it's fantastic

It's a pet card
I used to run Imps Mischief a lot more when my meta was smaller and I saw a aura deck weekly.
when in doubt, pull a don and go mono black oloro

text: :smiling_imp:
One of my favorite dismissals of EDHREC I've ever seen on Reddit was some salty-ass guy who wrote "well, the guy who runs the site plays Taniwha so that tells you everything!"
Lol
But Taniwa is fun.
Taniwha*
Who doesnt like getting worldslayered by taniwha
I did it with Zurgo. I did a lot of mean things with Zurgo.
:hand:
Board Wipe Tribal with him is awsome
I did that with Tajic so I can't say anything though.

EDHREC slack; where everyone spends their time debating whether old-ass card X provides a .0005% upgrade over their old-ass card Y, so they can run it in their Autumn Willow Farmer's Market tribal deck.
Autumn willow or Willow satyr as my partner commander  for Hazdur the Abbott
I hope WotC brings back partner in C18
Nein
Actually whatever, people like it, it's not my jam but to each their own
(<@U8YMWJ7H9> hasn't heard our respective partner arguments...time to revisit the classics!)
Let's hear it
EDH is complicated. We need training wheels commanders for people who are bad at deckbuilding. They have their place.
But Thrasios and Tynma and Tymna and Tana are tier 1 are they not?
Thrasios is a commander in UG with a colorless activated ability that gives you nothing but mana and card advantage. There wasn't much hope for him to become anything else.
I dislike Simic in general because it just leads to 'good stuff' builds, and this is the ultimate goodstuff commander.
I see
Some partners in general lend themselves to doing
I like partners as a new and interesting way to build decks
But snark aside some people don't like deckbuilding. If jamming two good commanders together to generate the color group you want is your thing, go for it
People do 5C commanders for the very same reason
I'll silently (or not so silently) judge you for it, but you be you
A buddy of mine suggested that every commander precon comes with an on theme partner legendary to keep that going for people. I don't hate the idea
Not terrible
Something that works in the 99 that isn't meant to be the head of the deck as is but is a decent partner commander to keep adding to those possibilities
The long-term problem with partners is working to ensure they don't create even more busted combinations.
True. But then does Wizards care if someone else has to ban a card ?
They're not the ones managing the format...yet
That leads to an interesting question for the Rules Committee. If such a combo happens in the future, would they ban the new partner or band the pair as commanders?
Since they got rid of the "banned as commander" part of the list I'd be curious too
They can always bring it back if necessary.
<@U286Q175Y> does not want any more partners ever
Make him fix it!
Make him fix it!
Unless they can automate it
I like partners as a concept.
For sure
I think it's a great idea
It just lends itself to the worst kind of deck building
This is where we disagree - its just the kind of deck building that <@U4V5EHQ2G> doesn't like vs. being intrinsically terrible.

If they did bring it back, it wouldn’t be one in every product. They’d have to make at least 2 of them in the product, more likely 3. They want new players to be able to mix and match right out of the box
From a design standpoint I get why devs love it. Make one new card, generate 15 new combinations, etc
Has anyone come across a [[Silas Renn]] build that was voltron?

text: No, I haven't come across Silas Renn
It's been my experience that he's not as good as he looked
Yeah he's pretty underwhelming. The ability isn't one that wants to be limited to Dimir.
he also dies to artifact removeal
Yep, there's that.
I made a graphic a while ago that showed the most popular partner pairs. I think I still have it. Should go back and update it sometime
I'm sure he's somewhere in the bottom half.
It does seem like the potential for shenanigans is there. The viability of those shenanigans seems scant though.
Top 3 have to be Tymna, Vial Smasher and Thrasios
This is info from about a year ago so some of it's changed since
Whoa he's second tier? Nice. That is a sweet flowchart by the way.
Thanks
I see Reyhan and Bruse in my meta from time to time
Together or separate?
I think it might actually be impossible to recreate if some of the commanders are now more popular. too many connections, can't be spaced out properly
Separately
Reyhan in the 99 of Skullbriar, Bruse as a singleton commander in a weird boros "storm" deck.
I think even Henry wouldn't mind losing to this deck.
That sounds pretty sweet actually.

text: I applaud that and would buy that person a beverage of their choosing to celebrate their jankness. I can absolutely dig that kind of deck.
He is the Johnniest Johnny.
And he hates magic. And it is glorious.
So he's destroying it from the inside, I love it.
I want him to try his hand at writing a column for EDHREC called "Steven Hates Everything."
Doesn't <@U4V5EHQ2G> already have that cornered?
Dana needs to broaden his horizons. He doesn't hate nearly enough stuff.
<@U4V5EHQ2G>, list 5 things you love about magic.
I love his articles though. I always have a 1,000 to 2,000 word explanation of why people's card choices are garbage for easy reference.
I love them also. It's possibly my favorite column.
That card doesn't suck!  ....Here read this.
Lol, I love a lot of stuff. I'm less cranky than Henry!
And fuck you for implying otherwise!
Yeah!
Somebody does need to write rant columns for EDHREC. They generate tons of traffic and discord.
Someone should do a Dear Abbey column
But be the worst, most sarcastic Abby ever.
Abby Hates You.
That would be fantastic.
I want to do an In the Margins on Terramorphic Expanse and Wilds, but my first try was mostly "stop being a fucking poor and buy a real mana base."
Ouch, that hurt my soul.
I can't even really use Ash Barrens anymore as that's seven bucks
Yeah I'm not a fan of that price either.
They're perfectly serviceable. I run both in various decks.
Are you doing one on DoJ, Dana?
Slaughter the Strong is hot.
Got to see it in action?
No, not yet. I'm fantasizing about how good it is.
It's wrath porn.
Yeah I considered running it in Elenda.
It's pretty fantastic for Alesha.
I'm still very much a fan of Settle the Wreckage.
Yeah <@U3QMCLQQG> DoJ is next.
department of justice
Expanse and Wilds are fine if you are on a budget, but there's enough duals now that there's just no need unless you're specifically going for the landfall trigger or shuffle
Day of Judgment
I'm running both in Mina and Denn for landfall triggers because I'm not spending $60 on a Tarn

I've always thought the panorama's and the visions fetched were fine budget alternatives. If you're pinching pennies they're great, not perfect or ideal, but for a $25 discount most times it's fine for people that play purely casual
yeah tarn will always be ridiculously priced.
The Panoramas at least get you three options
Yeah I'm a fan of panorama's.
And can tap for mana on their own, that's the biggest perk over the expanse/wilds
We're at the point where most people aren't running the shadows lands in two color decks
Yup. Those blow chunks
Once upon a time those would have been pretty good
Yeah mana bases have certainly come a long way.
Once upon a homelands?
Oh no. Those sucked even back in the day.
At least the mirage bad fetches were playable at that time.
Even before RtR. Shocks were super expensive then, so were allied fetches, there weren't the Khans tri-lands or enemy fast lands or the enemy man lands
No Ash Barrens, no Spire of Industry, no Mana Confluence
I actually have ideas for an “Agony Aunt”-style series. I just don’t have the time.
